titles.title: SF475 O God of Bethel, by whose hand

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
O God of Bethel, by whose hand
thy people still are fed;
who through this earthly pilgrimage
hast all our forebears led.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
Our vows, our prayers, we now present
before thy throne of grace:
God of our forebears, be the God
of their succeeding race.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Through each perplexing path of life
our wandering footsteps guide;
give us each day our daily bread,
and raiment fit provide.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
O spread thy covering wings around,
till all our wanderings cease,
and at our Father's loved abode
our souls arrive in peace.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
To thee as to our Covenant-God
we'll our whole selves resign;
and this not as a tithe alone,
for all we have is thine.
